text: Kemnay (Gaelic: Ceann a' Mhuigh) is a village 16 miles west of Aberdeen in Scotland. It has a population of about 7040 (2007). ==Sports== The golfer Paul Lawrie, who famously won the 1999 Open Championship is a former pupil of Kemnay Academy, as is Aberdeen FC footballer Darren Mackie. *Aberdeenshire Cricket Association == Other websites == * * Kemnay Village Community Web *Kemnay Academy Category:Towns in Aberdeenshire
title: Kemnay
